Installing PHP

PHP is an Open Source general-purpose scripting language used in software/web development. You need to have PHP7.1 or greater installed on the command line. Follow these instructions to install PHP on your system.

Install PHP Instructions

  • Windows
  • Mac
  • Linux
  • Docker

Tina4 Requirements

PHP 7.4 or greater is recommended.

According to zend.com, extensions are: “specially formed libraries or plug-ins that provides a function that can be used by many applications”.

Extension Directory extension_dir = “ext”

Required PHP Modules

  • cURL
  • fileinfo
  • GD
  • intl
  • mbstring
  • OpenSSL
  • SOAP
  • SQLite3
  • Tidy

On Mac etc you can run this command to get all the necessary files: 

 apt-get install php-curl php-fileinfo php-gd php-intl php-mbstring php-soap php-tidy php-xmlrpc php-xml
